definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]

sentences.english: But even that makes insecure Pakistanis jumpy.
sentences.chinese: 但是即使那樣也使感覺不安全的巴基斯坦人心驚肉跳。

sentences.english: He called it a narrow escape. But it was really a cliff-hanger .
sentences.chinese: 他稱之爲僥倖逃脫，但那確實讓他膽戰心驚。

sentences.english: With his feet on the mundane earth, Tripitaka was stunned.
sentences.chinese: 三藏腳踏了凡地，自覺心驚。

sentences.english: The robberies have chilled the mah-jongg network.
sentences.chinese: 搶劫案已經使麻將賭博網絡膽戰心驚。

sentences.english: Universally terrifying , it is the most dangerous part of the southern route on Everest.
sentences.chinese: 每一處都令人膽戰心驚，這是珠峯南線最危險的地段。

sentences.english: So when we got to the railway station I was all a-quiver.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我們到達火車站的時候，我們真是膽戰心驚。

sentences.english: It's nerve-wracking to watch the games that law enforcement and drug dealers play with each other.
sentences.chinese: 看執法部門和毒販之間的貓鼠遊戲讓人心驚膽戰。

sentences.english: I was terrified out of my mind when I climbed Mount Everest.
sentences.chinese: 當我爬埃費勒斯峯時，嚇得膽顫心驚。

sentences.english: Another form of the advancing state is more insidious.
sentences.chinese: 政府擴張的另一個形式更加讓人心驚膽戰。

sentences.english: No one can enjoy freedom without trembling.
sentences.chinese: 人們無不在膽顫心驚中享受着自由。

sentences.english: The old lady knew that something was going to happen, and she was very jumpy .
sentences.chinese: 這老太太知道要出事了，於是嚇得心驚肉跳。

sentences.english: She was jumpy during her job interview because she was so nervous.
sentences.chinese: 她在應徵面談的時候心驚肉跳，因爲她太緊張了。

sentences.english: Tom moved toward the strang sounds with his heart in his mouth .
sentences.chinese: 湯姆心驚膽顫地走近那奇怪的聲音。

sentences.english: His voice has a timid and tremulous sound .
sentences.chinese: 他的話音聽起來叫人膽戰又心驚。

sentences.english: Is there any creature more fearsome than the shark?
sentences.chinese: 還有什麼生物能比鯊魚還令人膽戰心驚的？

sentences.english: It was terrifying for us, as we were shaken by the waves.
sentences.chinese: 巨浪拍打在我們的身上，把我們嚇得心驚膽顫。

definition: overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
lit. wind and rain sweeping through the town (idiom)/fig. a big scandal/an uproar/the talk of the town
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
to feel a chill (as an emotional response)/to feel cold (as a clinical symptom)
lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
